sen.j: 武田 観柳斎（たけだ かんりゅうさい、天保元年（1830年）頃 - 慶応三年6月22日 (旧暦)（1867年7月23日））は、出雲国母里出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Kanryusai TAKEDA (around 1830 - July 23, 1867) was a member of Shinsengumi from the Mori Domain in Inaba Province.
sen.cmt: 「母里」は「母里藩」と補足しました。
sen.e: Kanryusai TAKEDA (around 1830 - July 23, 1867) was a member of Shinsengumi from the Mori Domain in Inaba Province.
Kanryusai TAKEDA (around 1830 - July 23, 1867) was a member of Shinsengumi from the Mori Domain in Inaba Province.

sen.j: 五番隊組長、兵学・文学師範、軍事方（軍奉行）。
sen.e: He was the leader of the Fifth Unit, instructor of military science and literature, and military commissioner.
sen.cmt: 「軍事方」は定訳不明。「軍奉行」と同義として、"military commissioner"としました。
sen.e: He was the leader of the Fifth Unit, instructor of military science and literature, and military commissioner.
He was the leader of the Fifth Unit, instructor of military science and literature, and military commissioner.

sen.j: 本名は福田廣。
sen.e: His real name was Hiroshi FUKUDA.
His real name was Hiroshi FUKUDA.

sen.j: 徳裕とも。
sen.e: Or it might have been Tokuhiro.
sen.cmt: 「廣」が本名、「徳裕」は諱だという情報もありますが、ここでは本名が「徳裕」の可能性もある、という意味に解釈しました。
sen.e: Another surname of his is Tokuhiro.
sen.cmt: どこかでは徳裕という名を使われていたと考えられますので、言い切った形に変更しました。
sen.e: Another surname of his is Tokuhiro.

sen.j: 脱藩ののち江戸に出向き、甲州流軍学を学ぶ。
sen.e: He left the domain and went to Edo where he studied the Koshu-ryu military science.
He left the domain and went to Edo, where he studied the Koshu-ryu military science.

sen.j: 甲斐国武田氏にちなみ、「武田観柳斎」を名乗るようになる。
sen.e: He started to call himself "Kanryusai TAKEDA," named after the Takeda clan in Kai Province.
He started to call himself "Kanryusai TAKEDA," named after the Takeda clan in Kai Province.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）に入隊。
sen.e: In 1863, he joined Shinsengumi.
In 1863, he joined Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 軍学者として近藤勇に重用され、翌元治元年（1864年）には副長助勤として幹部に抜擢。
sen.e: He was promoted as a scholar of military science by Isami KONDO, and became one of the executive members as a Fukucho-jokin (assistant vice commander) in 1864.
He was promoted as a scholar of military science by Isami KONDO, and was selected as one of the executive members as a Fukucho-jokin (assistant vice commander) in 1864.
sen.cmt: 原文の「抜擢」という意味を入れるため、”became”を”was selected as”に変更しました。
sen.e: He was promoted as a scholar of military science by Isami KONDO, and was selected as one of the executive members as a Fukucho-jokin (assistant vice commander) in 1864.

sen.j: 同年6月5日の池田屋事件の際、武田らは長州藩人などの潜伏浪士に便弁を図っていた古高俊太郎を捕える。
sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident on June 5th of the same year, Takeda and others captured Shuntaro FURUTAKA, who was accommodating Roshi (masterless samurai) in hiding, including those from the Choshu Domain.

In the Ikedaya Incident on June 5th of the same year, Takeda and others captured Shuntaro FURUTAKA, who was accommodating Roshi (masterless samurais) in hiding, including those from the Choshu Domain.

sen.e: In the Ikedaya Incident on June 5th of the same year, Takeda and others captured Shuntaro FURUTAKA, who was accommodating Roshi (masterless samurais) in hiding, including those from the Choshu Domain.

sen.j: その後近藤隊に属し、池田屋の周囲を固めた。
sen.e: He then belonged to Kondo's squad and guarded the perimeter of Ikedaya.

sen.j: 戦闘時は土佐国浪士・大秋鼎を斬殺し、褒賞金を賜っている。
sen.e: In the fight he killed Kanae OAKI, a Roshi from the Tosa Domain, and received reward money for it.

sen.e: In the fight he killed Kanae OAKI, a Roshi from the Tosa Domain, and received reward money for it.

sen.j: 7月19日の禁門の変では、軍事方として戦略担当幹部となり、天王山攻略などで甲州流軍学を発揮した。
sen.e: In the Kinmon Incident on July 19, he was responsible for strategy as a military commissioner and demonstrated his mastery of the Koshu-ryu military science in the capture of Mt. Tenno and so on.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）の組織再編で五番隊組長になる。
sen.e: The group was restructured in 1865 and he became the leader of the Fifth Unit.
The group was restructured in 1865 and he became the leader of the Fifth Unit.
The group was restructured in 1865 and he became the leader of the Fifth Unit.

sen.j: 隊では甲州流軍学をふるい隊士の訓練を行っていたが、その巧みな弁舌で幹部連中に媚びへつらう姿に嫌悪感を示す隊士も少なくなかったという。
sen.e: Although he trained the group members in the Koshu-ryu military science, many members were said to be disgusted with him for flattering the executive members with his eloquent tongue.
He trained the group members in the Koshu-ryu military science at the squad, where many members were said to be disgusted with him for flattering the executive members with his eloquent tongue.
sen.cmt: 意味として逆接ではないと思われますので、althoughを削除しました。原文の「隊では」が訳文に見当たりませんでしたので”at the squad, where”と追加して繋げました。
sen.e: He trained the group members in the Koshu-ryu military science at the squad, where many members were said to be disgusted with him for flattering the executive members with his eloquent tongue.

sen.j: その後、新選組が幕府に準えて洋式調練を取り入れたことにより、武田の軍学は徐々に時代遅れのものとなっていった。
sen.e: Shinsengumi later adopted the Western style military training in accordance with the policy of Bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) and Takeda's military science gradually became outdated.

sen.j: 隊内での立場を失った武田は、脱退を図って伊東甲子太郎に接近したり、倒幕派である薩摩藩との接触も企てるなどした。
sen.e: Takeda, who had lost his position in the group, approached Kashitaro ITO with the intention to leave the group, and also attempted to contact the anti-Bakufu Satsuma clan.

sen.j: しかしそれらの行動を近藤や土方歳三らに看破される。
sen.e: However, Kondo and Toshizo HIJIKATA detected these actions.
However, Isami KONDO and Toshizo HIJIKATA detected these actions.
sen.cmt: 訳文ですと近藤と歳三両者の苗字が土方と誤解する人もいるかと思いましたので、近藤の名前の勇を追加して土方とバランスを揃えました。
sen.e: However, Isami KONDO and Toshizo HIJIKATA detected these actions.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）6月22日、除隊を申し出た武田の送別会と称し、近藤が宴を開いた。
sen.e: On June 22, 1867, Kondo gave a farewell party to Takeda, who had offered his resignation.
On June 22, 1867, Kondo gave a farewell party for Takeda, who had offered his resignation.
sen.cmt: 武田のための会ですので、前置詞をforに変更しました。
sen.e: On June 22, 1867, Kondo gave a farewell party for Takeda, who had offered his resignation.

sen.j: しかしこれは、無論武田暗殺の宴であった。
sen.e: However, it was of course a party to assassinate Takeda.

sen.cmt: 判りやすくするために、”of course”の前後にコンマを追加しました。

sen.j: 宴の後、斎藤一、篠原泰之進が武田を送ることになり、伏見薩摩藩邸に共に向かった。
sen.e: After the party, Hajime SAITO and Tainoshin SHINOHARA left there with Takeda to accompany him to the residence of Satsuma Domain in Fushimi.

sen.j: 途中鴨川 (淀川水系)銭取橋で斎藤一によって暗殺された。
sen.e: On the way there, he was assassinated by Hajime SAITO at the Zenitoribashi Bridge over the Kamo-gawa River (Yodogawa river system).
